sentences.en: At first only one newspaper, Hankyoreh, regarded as a provocative gadfly, dared print them.
sentences.cn: 一开始仅有一家报纸, Hankyoreh,它被认为是一只挑衅的牛虻, 敢于刊登这些指控.

sentences.en: Bravery, selfishness, and endurance are the characters which can be found easily on the Gadfly.
sentences.cn: 勇敢 、 无私和意志力在牛虻身上都表现得很突出.

sentences.en: DiLorenzo's subject was the filmmaker and liberal gadfly Michael Moore.
sentences.cn: 蒂洛伦佐谈到了制片人和自由牛虻迈克尔·摩尔.

sentences.en: Egypt a beautiful heifer, but a gadfly is coming against her from the north.
sentences.cn: 埃及是肥美的母牛犊.但出于北方的毁灭(作牛虻)到了. 来到了.

sentences.en: Egypt is a beautiful heifer, but a gadfly is coming against her from the north.
sentences.cn: 20埃及是肥美的母牛犊.但出于北方的毁灭〔毁灭或作牛虻来到了、来到了.

sentences.en: Egypt is a beautiful heifer; A gadfly from the north has come on her.
sentences.cn: 20埃及是肥美的母牛犊; 但出于北方的牛来到她身上了.

sentences.en: Ethel Lilian Voynich published Gadfly in 1904.
sentences.cn: 艾捷尔·丽莲·夫尼契于1904年出版了《牛虻》.

sentences.en: Gemma thought Gadfly was Arthur, but she could not make sure.
sentences.cn: 琼玛虽感到牛虻是亚瑟, 却不能确定.

sentences.en: It still remains to be seen whether Buchanan will be just a gadfly or a real threat to the president.
sentences.cn: 布坎南只是故意搅局还是对总统构成真正的威胁，这还有待观察。

sentences.en: Maybe Arthur had been a truly gadfly, flying happily in the sky.
sentences.cn: 或许,亚瑟真的变成了一直牛虻, 自由快乐地在天空中飞翔.

sentences.en: She'd been there 30 years but was still a gadfly. I loved that.
sentences.cn: 尽管在那儿干了30多年,她与职工之间依然直来直去, 有时也刺儿你一下,我就喜欢她的那种性格.

sentences.en: The Gadfly was written by Irish authoress Ethel Lilian Voynich and published in England in 1897.
sentences.cn: 《牛虻》一书由爱尔兰女作家艾捷尔?丽莲?伏尼契写成并于1897年在英国出版.

sentences.en: The Gadfly's endurance was failing him at last.
sentences.cn: 牛虻的忍受力也终于不能维持了.

trans.tran_en: someone who annoys other people by criticizing them
